entries.author: dave_cross
entries.text: Dave needs images of traffic lights, for some secret squirrel project he's working on. He ended up creating SVG::TrafficLight, which makes it easy to draw SVG traffic lights.
entries.title: Drawing Traffic Lights With Perl

entries.text: Steve shows how to talk to an Arduino from Perl, over the I2C bus.
entries.title: Reading/writing Arduino pins over I2C with Perl

entries.author: ruth_bavousett
entries.text: The third article in a series, this one shows how you can use the Neo4j graph database from Perl.
entries.title: Neo4j in your own software: Very basic Perl hacking

entries.title: NICEPERL's lists

entries.author: mohammad_anwar
entries.text: On Sunday 23rd July, Mohammad did a release to CPAN, making it the 1000th consecutive day that he'd done a CPAN release on. That's nearly 3 years (1095 days). In that time he's released a lot of his own modules, but has also got co-maint on a lot of others, and adopted some of those.
entries.title: 1000th consecutive days releasing to CPAN

entries.author: tom_wyant
entries.text: Tom introduces his PPIx::Regexp module, which provides a PPI-like interface for parsing regular expressions.
entries.title: PPIx-Regexp Perl Version Functionality

entries.text: The weekly summary of news from P5P, the headline of which is the releases of 5.24.2 and 5.22.4.
entries.title: P5P Mailing List Summary: July 10th-16th

entries.author: steve_bertrand
entries.text: A new version of berrybrew has been released. This lets you have multiple versions of Perl installed on a Windows machine, and switch between them as your default Perl.
entries.title: berrybrew, the Perlbrew for Windows, updated to v1.13
Strawberry Perl 5.24.2.1 released
entries.ts: The latest release of Strawberry Perl, one of the main Perl 5 distros for Windows.

entries.text: An article about Libraries.io, a service that has data on language libraries, including CPAN and those from 32 other package managers. The data from this service is now available.
entries.title: How to use Libraries.io data from millions of open source projects

entries.text: This is a friendly, dynamic team based in Canary Wharf and for the first time the company is offering visa sponsorship for the right candidate. If you’ve got experience with Modern Perl this could be your opportunity to make the move to sunny London.

header:
Mohammad Anwar has done at least one CPAN release per day for the last 1000 days,
adopting a bunch of CPAN distributions along the way.
His passion for help CPAN and CPAN authors, is admirable!

Check out the list of talks for TPC::EU, which has now been finalised. And if you're going to TPC::EU, you could help out the EPO, if you're going to be there the day before the conference proper starts.
subject: 1000 days of CPAN releases.
